importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article highlights the ongoing humanitarian crisis in Gaza following the ceasefire, indicating the current state of food supply operations and the urgency of expanding humanitarian access.
This date marks a critical update on WFP’s food delivery assessments, showing the timeline of progress or stagnation in aid delivery after the US-brokered ceasefire.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The current year reflects the ongoing humanitarian emergency in Gaza, with the ceasefire and aid delivery still in flux, emphasizing the urgency of sustained international intervention.

keyTakeAways: Food supplies to Gaza are significantly below the WFP’s daily target of 2,000 tonnes, with only 750 metric tonnes entering daily.
Only two Israeli-controlled crossings (Karem Abu Salem and al-Karara) are currently operational, limiting humanitarian access.
The US-brokered ceasefire is critical to sustaining aid delivery and preventing famine, especially in northern Gaza.
The WFP has 26 food distribution points open, up from five, but still far below the target of 145 points across Gaza.
The Rafah border crossing remains closed until Hamas delivers the bodies of deceased captives, which currently hampers access to the north of Gaza.
Nutrition supplies have reached northern Gaza via the south but are insufficient for the population’s needs.
Gaza residents are storing food due to fear of supply disruptions, indicating deep insecurity about the ceasefire’s sustainability.
Humanitarian aid currently feeds about half a million people for two weeks, highlighting the scale of the food crisis.

namedEntities.name: UN World Food Programme (WFP)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An international humanitarian organization that provides food aid to vulnerable populations.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The WFP is central to the article as it reports on current food supply levels and urgently calls for more open crossings to meet Gaza’s needs.

namedEntities.name: Karem Abu Salem
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An Israeli-controlled border crossing into Gaza, located in the southern part of the territory.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is one of the only two operational crossings currently allowing food into Gaza, making it a key point for humanitarian access.

namedEntities.name: al-Karara (Kerem Shalom in Israel)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An Israeli-controlled border crossing into Gaza, located in the central part of the territory.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This crossing is currently operational and helps deliver food to central Gaza, contributing to the limited supply network.

namedEntities.name: Rafah border crossing
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A crossing between Gaza and Egypt, currently closed.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Its closure prevents access to northern Gaza and limits the potential for humanitarian aid to reach the northern regions of the Strip.

namedEntities.name: Salah al-Din Street
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A major north-south street in Gaza, currently not accessible to WFP convoys.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The WFP has not been allowed to use this route, which would have enabled aid to reach northern Gaza more effectively.

namedEntities.name: Hamas
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Palestinian political and military organization responsible for governing Gaza.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hamas is involved in the prisoner exchange process, which directly affects the opening of crossings and access to humanitarian aid.

namedEntities.name: Qassam Brigades
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A militant wing of Hamas responsible for armed actions in Gaza.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Qassam Brigades have committed to delivering the bodies of Israeli captives, which is a condition for reopening the Rafah crossing.

namedEntities.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Israeli Prime Minister, who has stated that the Rafah crossing will remain closed until Hamas fulfills its obligations.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His position directly influences the closure of the Rafah crossing, limiting humanitarian access to northern Gaza.

namedEntities.name: Donald Trump
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former US President who brokered a ceasefire and proposed a 20-point plan for ending the war in Gaza.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His role in brokering the ceasefire and advocating for full humanitarian aid delivery makes him a key political figure in the current situation.

namedEntities.name: US President Donald Trump
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The same entity as above, referenced in the context of the 20-point plan and ceasefire.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His diplomatic efforts are central to the ceasefire’s sustainability and the promise of full aid delivery to Gaza.

namedEntities.name: 2,000 tonnes
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The WFP’s daily food supply target for Gaza.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This target represents the benchmark for adequate food distribution, and current levels are far below it, highlighting the severity of the crisis.

namedEntities.name: 750 metric tonnes
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The current daily food supply entering Gaza.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This figure illustrates the shortfall in aid, emphasizing the urgent need for more crossings and improved access.

namedEntities.name: 145 food distribution points
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The WFP's goal for the total number of food distribution sites across Gaza.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The current number of 26 points shows a significant gap in coverage, indicating insufficient aid infrastructure.

namedEntities.name: Half a million people
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The number of people currently being fed by existing food supplies.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This figure reflects the scale of the humanitarian emergency and the limited reach of current aid efforts.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The UN World Food Programme (WFP) reports that food supplies to Gaza remain critically short of the daily target of 2,000 tonnes, with only 750 metric tonnes entering via just two open crossings—Karem Abu Salem and al-Karara—due to the closure of others, including Rafah. Despite a slight increase in distribution points from five to 26, the WFP still falls far short of its goal of 145 distribution sites. The US-brokered ceasefire, supported by President Donald Trump’s 20-point plan, is seen as vital to enabling humanitarian access and preventing famine, especially in northern Gaza. Hamas has pledged to deliver the remains of 13 captives, with two more recently handed over, which is a condition for reopening Rafah. However, residents are storing food out of fear of future disruptions, and current supplies are only enough for half a million people for two weeks, underscoring the urgent need for expanded crossings and sustained international support.
title: WFP says food supplies to Gaza below targets, urges more crossings to open
